Key Match Events: Nestor Cortes gave up five runs on nine hits in four innings.
Juan Soto misplayed Brendan Donovan’s fly ball to deep right-center for a double.
Jordan Walker’s single to right scored Donovan, giving St. Louis a 1-0 lead.
Masyn Winn snuck a two-run double down the left field line.
Luken Baker hit a two-run shot to left to make it 5-2.
Paul Goldschmidt dropped an easy throw for an error in the fifth inning.
Alex Verdugo hit an RBI single and Gleyber Torres followed with another to end Mikolas' afternoon.
Gleyber Torres drilled a sacrifice fly to right-center that tied the game.
Lars Nootbaar hit a two-out, three-run double off Kahnle in the seventh inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone said, 'Tough day for us. We know how important these games are.'
Boone added, 'We had another opportunity to win a series that we weren't able to finish and that sucks. We've got to play our best.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees gave up a season-high 21 hits.
The game was affected by rain delays.
